result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven T. Bowers

records.addlTxt:
(2:43 PM case called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Defendant Steven T. Bowers appeared by video, in custody in the Chippewa County Jail without counsel. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advises has Chippewa County matters pending and was appointed Attorney Les Liptak in those matters.
Defendant advises hasn't spoken with Attorney Liptak yet.
Defendant advises wants an attorney before proceeding forward.
Court advises defendant to contact the State Public Defender's Office to obtain counsel.
State moves to quash warrant. Court orders warrant is quashed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
for transport for a hearing on 10/25/2022 at 2:00 p.m.

2:08 PM case called. Defendant Steven T. Bowers appeared by video, in custody in Chippewa County without counsel.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant would like an attorney. Court finds based on their want for an attorney, defendant is waiving time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
Defendant will be transported and appear in person unless he waives his right to appear in person prior to the next hearing. 
Clerk notes there is a warrant in the case. Court notes warrant will be addressed at the next hearing. 
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
for transport for a hearing on 10/18/2022 at 2:00 p.m.

Case called at 11:35 AM.
Defendant Steven T. Bowers not in court. Attorney Tiffany Winter appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin.
State notes that the Defendant is currently in custody at the Chippewa County Jail and has refused to appear for every scheduled hearing in this case.
State requests a $1,000 Cash Bond and that the Court finds that the Defendant has waived his right to appear. 
Court so orders the bond amended to a $1,000 Cash Bond with all conditions as previously ordered and finds the Defendant has waived his right to appear.
Preliminary Hearing: 10/18/22 at 2:00 PM.

Conditions:
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

11:16am Honorable Emily Long for Br. 1 Intake. Defendant Steven Bowers refused to appear via Zoom video, from in custody in the Chippewa County Jail. Therefore, Chippewa County Jail did not connect to Zoom. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. New date set.
Return on warrant scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:30 PM Defendant Steven T. Bowers not in court.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. This is the time and date set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant was given notice of today's date. Warrant ordered; $50 or body only.

Conditions:
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

(11:19 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Steven T. Bowers in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail and does not appear in court or via Zoom. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Steven T. Bowers.
Attorney Anderson advises the defendant is refusing to cooperate and did not want to speak with Attorney Anderson.
Court reviews the criminal complaint probable cause portion and finds probable cause.
Court finds the defendant is waiving right to a appear.
Court sets bond and schedules preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Conditions:
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

**Defendant refused to sign**
